pages.title: Purpose
pages.text: The breeder reactor converts enriched uranium dust into plutonium nuggets—the ultimate fuel source. Feed crusty_chunks:uranium_enriched_dust in the top and collect crusty_chunks:plutonium_nugget from the empty_fuel_rod blocks. Requires significant power investment.

pages.title: Multiblock Structure
pages.text: Structure mirrors the power reactor. $(bold)Key layers (top->bottom):$()$(li)Layer 4: Four empty_fuel_rod blocks (E) for output collection.$(li)Layer 3: breeder_reactor_interface at center, surrounded by reaction chambers (H), control rods (R), and reactor casing (C).$(li)Layer 2: breeder_reactor_core at center with the same surrounding ring.$(li)Layer 1: breeder_reactor_port (0) at center for coolant/power.

pages.title: The Critical Difference
pages.text: Compared to the power reactor, Layer 3 has $(bold)breeder_reactor_interface$() at the center instead of the power interface. This interface controls the uranium→plutonium transmutation reaction.

pages.title: Operation
pages.text: $(bold)Setup:$() Attach RF power to the breeder_reactor_port (0).$(br)$(bold)Input:$() Feed crusty_chunks:uranium_enriched_dust via hopper on top.$(br)$(bold)Output:$() Collect crusty_chunks:plutonium_nugget from the four E blocks.

pages.title: Power Consumption
pages.text: The breeder consumes $(bold)substantial RF$() to transmute uranium. Plan your power infrastructure accordingly—a dedicated reactor often powers the breeder. The plutonium output justifies the energy cost.

pages.title: Fuel Crafting
pages.text: Once you have plutonium_nuggets, combine them with reactor_casing to craft ultra-high-density fuel rods. These produce $(bold)even more RF$() per burn cycle and last much longer than standard fuel.
